about_the_game:
"Riddle Me Bunny: Nonogram" A charming nonogram puzzle game where numbers transform into delightful pixel art. Use number clues to reveal hidden pictures and restore your village's mysteriously vanishing scenery!

Game Features

  • Engaging Nonogram Puzzles Solve these beloved picture-logic puzzles (also known as nonograms) by following number clues to reveal hidden images. Beginner-friendly with helpful tutorials and hint system.

  • Watch the Village Come to Life Each completed puzzle transforms into beautiful pixel art. Solve over 50 puzzles to restore the village's vanished scenery piece by piece.

  • Heartwarming Adventure Join Nono, a math-loving watchmaker's daughter, and her mysterious companion Gram on a quest to save their village. Meet quirky villagers and uncover the truth behind the village's transformation!

Story

In the attic of her father's watchmaker shop, Nono discovers a peculiar mechanical headband called "Riddle Me Bunny." When she puts it on, she meets Gram, a small blue rabbit who appears out of nowhere. But their magical encounter is cut short as the village's scenery begins mysteriously transforming into numerical puzzles. Now Nono and Gram must embark on a whimsical adventure to save their beloved village.

Characters

Nono The daughter of the village's only watchmaker. A kind-hearted girl with a steampunk style who loves numbers so much that she can't help but share random statistics and mathematical facts.

Gram A mysterious blue rabbit who appears when Nono wears the Riddle Me Bunny headband. Though often bemused by Nono's mathematical ramblings, he supports her with gentle guidance. What other secrets might this magical companion be hiding...?

  • Processor: ANy 64 bit Intel

  • Graphics: Any GPU that supports at least OpenGL ES2.0, or DirectX 9.0
